dialog: Hi Medi, I just had a hepatitis B vaccine. Do I need to take any special precautions?
Congratulations on getting vaccinated! It's important to continue practicing good hygiene and avoiding contact with contaminated blood or bodily fluids.
Should I avoid sharing personal items?
Yes, it's a good idea to avoid sharing personal items such as razors or toothbrushes with others. You should also be cautious when getting tattoos or piercings.
What if I come into contact with someone who has hepatitis B?
If you come into contact with someone who has hepatitis B, it's important to seek medical advice right away. Your doctor may recommend post-exposure prophylaxis to help prevent infection.
Thanks, Medi. Is there anything else I should know?
Just remember to continue practicing good hygiene, avoid sharing personal items, and let your doctor know if you have any symptoms of hepatitis B.
